channel.title: Looking for High-Risk, High-Reward strategies
channel.description:
I've been experimenting with some dangerous plays, most if not all of which I learned from others. I'm looking for some more. So far I've tried:
* Claim Prince to King before real Prince does, get protection and also get real Prince outed. * Claim Inq. * Claim Noble, have a teammate accuse somebody and claim you forced them to vote. * Claim Psychic, whisper King that this is "hidden" whisper and this guy is sus. * Claim Hunter, leave a bear deathnote and say they were puppetstringed into your bear (I love this one). * Claim Paladin as Assassin, say you were bled by Cult leader and this guy is Cult (to out Sheriffs lol).
What I haven't tried yet is faking a wisp and saying I was attacked and healed (trying to think of a way to make this work).
Does anybody have more crazy ideas to try out?

item.title: Looking for High-Risk, High-Reward strategies
item.dc:creator: NuclearBurrito
item.description:
Claim Prince on the stand as fool when king hadn’t been doing anything. Gets you Order exed so fast.

Claim Prince when stepping up as a converted Royal.

Claim Hunter as Prince and Tell the Hunter to do the other way around.

Jump into King as Possessor and then claim Bewildered.

Whisper king that someone is scum (with a sheriff/pally claim) and then Empower reap the King. If he OE’s you then your soul will save you and he can’t out you the next day because he is reaped.

Read full topic

item.description:
Claim Hunter and offer to vote up any other hunter claims as an expendable member of the evil faction.

Sure you die but so does the Hunter and you free up a convert slot.

item.description:

item.dc:creator: Vandalay
item.description:
Biperspectival:

Claim observer as the nk, find someone death immune and assume they’re mm to out them. If you can pull this off d5, you’ll never be suspect again.

but… how would a legitimate observer find the MM (I suppose claim peak found unseen but obviously not specifically calling it MM)? and how to explain the first 3 nights of which if anyone actually asks for logs, one of the people you claim to have watched should have a visit, and should have been visited by someone else.

then of course, the side risk of the immune being alc. or guarded by king. or scorned etc…

item.title: Looking for High-Risk, High-Reward strategies
item.dc:creator: snipufin
item.description:
What I’ve theorized as a Mastermind is an aggressive bussing strategy: basically once you get a convert off, you wait one night and then you bus either the assassin or the new kid the next day. That gives you a new convert the next night, which essentially works as an extra kill (since you have 1 less BD), all the while giving you a proper Sheriff (or Observer, if that’s what you want) credential.
